summary: "In Utero" is Nirvana's third and last album, released in 1993. They wanted a rougher sound than their previous album, "Nevermind." Frontman Kurt Cobain's personal struggles are hinted at in the lyrics. Recorded quickly in Minnesota, the album was initially thought too harsh for release. It was remixed for a better sound. "In Utero" was a big hit, topping charts in the US and UK. It included successful singles like "Heart-Shaped Box" and "All Apologies." The album is now five-times platinum in the US and has sold 15 million copies worldwide.
title: In Utero
